generif.text: The transmembrane peptide DWORF activates SERCA2a via dual mechanisms.
Dwarf open reading frame (DWORF) is a direct activator of the sarcoplasmic reticulum calcium pump SERCA.
Inhibitory and stimulatory micropeptides preferentially bind to different conformations of the cardiac calcium pump.

BP.term: regulation of slow-twitch skeletal muscle fiber contraction
regulation of ATPase-coupled calcium transmembrane transporter activity
positive regulation of calcium ion import into sarcoplasmic reticulum

interpro.desc: Sarcoplasmic/endoplasmic reticulum calcium ATPase regulator DWORF

name: small transmembrane regulator of ion transport 1
other_names: Sarcoplasmic/endoplasmic reticulum calcium ATPase regulator DWORF
sarcoplasmic/endoplasmic reticulum calcium ATPase regulator DWORF
summary: Predicted to enable enzyme activator activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of calcium ion transport and regulation of striated muscle contraction. Predicted to act upstream of or within positive regulation of ATPase-coupled calcium transmembrane transporter activity and positive regulation of calcium ion import. Predicted to be located in sarcoplasmic reticulum membrane. [provided by Alliance of Genome Resources, Apr 2022]
